name: Al Colonnato di San Pietro Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009
reviews.text: My husband and I and our 20-year-old daughter stayed in the Sun Apt. for 5 nights on our first visit to Rome. Rosa Maria was fantastic. After sorting out confusion about where the taxi dropped us (we had the B&B address by mistake instead of the apartment bldg), it was a truly wonderful experience. Rosa Maria gave us a map, information about local restaurants, transportation tips, and booked reservations for us at the Borghese Gallery. As others have said, the apartment was spotless, and stocked with fruit, milk, water, butter, jams, crispy toast, etc. We bought bread at the nearby supermarket and were able to make our own toast, coffee and tea in the morning. We meant to check out the B & B but were so busy we never got the chance. When we had trouble withdrawing all of the cash needed to pay for the apt. at the end of our stay, Rosa Maria graciously offered us a discount. We could not have asked for a warmer, nicer, more helpful hostess than Rosa Maria, who loves Rome and obviously loves helping visitors learn to love it, too. We will definitely stay again if we return to Rome. As far as the location goes, although it is a bit of a trek from the Vatican side of the city to other sites, we enjoyed walking across bridges and exploring the different neighborhoods (e.g., it is a very reasonable walk to Trastevere and to Campo di' Fiori for dinner).
reviews.title: The perfect apartment to call home in Rome, with the perfect hostess.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: This place was exactly what I was looking for, clean, nice, central and good public transport. Just perfect for me!
reviews.title: Perfect for me!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: I just loved every minute of staying at Al Colonnato.
reviews.title: I Dont Care To Ever Look Anywhere Else When In Rome!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next time I go to Rome I will stay here again.
reviews.title: The Best!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I honestly did not expect much....
reviews.title: A really lovely apartment to stay in close to the centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very well looked after B&B in a great location only 2 mins walk from St Peter's Square. V close to bus stop to get into the city. Nearby there are a few nice restaurants and handy shops. Delightful hosts as confirmed in all the reviews! Good value. Great breakfasts.
reviews.title: Very friendly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The positive reviews are well deserved, not hype, if a quiet private getaway is the kind of retreat you like. We had a wonderful but too short (2 nights) Roman vacation, and stayed at Al Colonnato di San Pietro. Actually, because we booked so close to our trip, we stayed in the Sun Apartment, in a building about a block away from the B&B, with a mini kitchen (single burner) supplied with some comestibles including biscotti and marmalade, cereal, a heaping bowl of fresh fruit, milk, tea, and coffee, etc. Rosa Maria, the hostess at the B&B, also lets the Sun Apartment and the adjacent Moon Apartment just down the street from the B&B. The room was spacious by European standards, spotless, with a nice bathroom and plenty of privacy. The quiet neighborhood is mostly populated by "locals" as opposed to tourists, so you can get a feel for the real Rome, but it is a very short walk to St. Peter's (San Pietro) Basilica, the Vatican Museum, and also a short trek across the bridge and the Tiber to old Rome. We kept pinching ourselves--can you believe we are sleeping within shouting distance from Michelangelo's Pietà and Sistine Chapel?! In fact, you can hear the bells from San Pietro from the room--what a wonderful alarm clock! From the moment we arrived, exhausted, we were whisked by Mercedes from the airport (we highly recommend the car service Rosa Maria arranged for 40€). We were made to feel comfortable by the warm welcome from Rosa Maria when we arrived at the flat. We tried both of the neighborhood restaurants that she recommended, which were excellent and quite reasonably priced for Rome. One in fact had some of the best pasta we've had in Italy! Rosa Maria and Meldi, her charming assistant, invited us to have a cappuccino to chat and talk politics in the B&B apartment on our last morning there, when we dropped off our luggage, which was a treat. Next time, we will make arrangements earlier and get one of the lovely rooms in the B&B itself (which we took a peek at)!
reviews.title: Quiet Romantic Retreat, A Stone's Throw from the Vatican

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in June, what a find. The 2 ladies who run the B & B - Rosa and Melda - are superb hosts. The B & B is 'no frills' accommodation in a superb location, reasonably priced and with everything you need for a stay in Rome. This is the second time we have been to Rome and we found this accommodation to be a gem in the beautiful city of Rome - well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Great B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sun Apartment and it was perfect. Rosa Maria arranged a taxi for us from the airport (€45) and she was waiting for us to show us the apartment and to tell us about places we had to visit and where we could have nice meals. The apartment is very close to the Vatican and the railway station is just 10 minutes away so that was easy for us going from Rome to the harbour to start our cruise. Apartment building has an elevator and it's a very quiet place. The room itself is spotless and the bathroom is great. You can make your own coffee or tea and there is plenty of fresh fruit, milk, water, cereals, butter and jam to make your own breakfast. Nobody bothers you and one thing, you have to make your own bed but who cares?
reviews.title: Spotless, safe place, nicely located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rome is a fantastic city and there is so much to do and see that one visit isn't enough. The Roma pass (€20) gives you 3 days of transportation and 2 tickets and discounts on additional visits for museums and that's a great deal.
reviews.title: Superb hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed stayed here 4 nights and I can't tell you how much we are glad we stayed with Rosa Maria and Meldi. First of all the room B&B is in a great location. Quiet, good restaurants within proximity and within blocks of Vatican City. So close in fact, we enjoyed walking over to St. Peter's Square for a after dinner stroll. The room was plenty spacious, very clean, neatly decorated, and very comfortable. The we had the bathroom outside the room which wasn't a problem at all. It too was clean and spacious. I always looked forward to the breakfast in the mornings which Medli brought to our room via a cart. The fruit cup was fantastic! It also included your breads, yougurt, jams, orange juice and a delicious cappucino. I always asked Meldi for one more which she gladly provided. She is always so cheerful and always greets with a smile. But what I liked just as much as the other great things, is the attention and service that Rosa Maria gave to us on our stay. She was always helpful in plotting the best routes to our sightseeing tours, gave us helpful tips on transportation around the city, and made sure if we ever needed anything to give her a phone call. She also set up our taxi ride to the airport which she absolutely tried to get us the best price given it was so early in the morning. Rosa Maria and Meldi truly were wonderful people. I will absolutely stay here on my next visit to Rome.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B, Wonderful Owner, Great Value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family stayed at the Sun Room apartment in July/09. It was perfect . Extremely clean, and a wonderful location. There is a grocery store 2 blocks away and a laundromat. one block away. Rosa Maria was very helpful with tips and also instrumental locating our lost luggage. She braved a terrible rain storm to come and greet us. The doorman Antonio was also very friendly and cheerful. We certainly did not want to leave.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: P.S. HI ROSA MARIA!
reviews.title: Everything was just wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even before I left for Rome, Rosa Maria was very helpful by emailing me all the information that I needed on how to arrive at her B&B. Upon arrival, both she and Meldi where there to meet us and took care of getting all our luggage (which was a lot) upstairs.
reviews.title: Wonderful owner, great location!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B is located on the 2nd floor of an old building but luckily, there is a small elevator that was useful in getting the luggage upstairs as well as for our use after a long, tiring day of touring. We were given all the necessary keys to make sure that we had access, but also that we felt safe.
reviews.title: Great price, great location, friendly staff, perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maria and her staff were exceptionally friendly and accommodating. The B&Bis just over the bridge from downtown Rome - almost beside St. Peter's Basilica. The area was a little loud, but as long as we closed the window at night we were able to sleep soundly. The room had air conditioning and we paid a little extra to have our own bathroom. Breakfast was served promptly every morning and the room was kept immaculate.
reviews.title: Great out of the way location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Most importantly for us, there were lots of restaurants within a block, so we could tour all day, be tired at night and find a lovely restaurant close by.
reviews.title: Stayed in her apartments - GREAT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The B&B is also right on the main bus route which we utilized with the Roma Pass.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Rosa Maria is wonderful and very helpful! We had a large family group traveling together, and used one of her B&B rooms and her two apartments which were located 2 blocks away. I was in the "moon" apartment with my husband and 14-month old daughter. The place is very quaint with its old-fashioned keys, tiny elevator, and hardwood floors.
reviews.title: Best B&B in Italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The units had air conditioning which cooled quickly at the end of each day (we turned it off while out). The kitchenette had an electric burner, small fridge, and a few plates & utensils for our use. We were left with lots of fresh fruit, biscotti, fruit spreads, cereal, and milk for breakfasts. The bathroom is really nice and very spacious. The shower included a rainfall shower head which was very comforting t the end of our very long, hot days touring Rome.
reviews.title: The apartments are very nice. It will be perfect if windows are soundproof.

aka: Al Colonnato Di San Pietro b&b
description: The B&B is located 100 metres away from Saint Peter's Cathedral.The flat which has been recently refurbished was designed by an excellent architect. The windows equipped with air gap glassess, the solid wooden furniture, the beds equipped with wired bed frames and orthopaedic mattresses, the anallergic fabrics, the safe, the minibar and the foldway tables, they make the really comforting B&B.
